..Broader Motivation
What explains the large differences in living standards across countries?
Large productivity differences across countries (Klenow and
Rodriguez-Clare 1997; Jones 2016)
Countries are slow in adopting advanced technologies and best
practices
Low income countries are less eﬀicient in allocating factors of
production to best uses
Strong link between financial development and economic growth
This paper: Policies and institutions that generate misallocation may have
dynamic consequences that interact with financial frictions
Nasir Hossein Dad (2023 North American Productivity Conference) Financial Frictions, Policy Distortions and Productivity Investments March 25th, 2023 2 / 33

..Financial Frictions, Policy Distortions, Misallocation
Financial frictions
1 Equity constraints; lower firm-level productivity (T echnology)
Literature focuses on productivity losses from financial frictions
through selection (extensive margin)
This paper: impact of financial frictions through technology (intensive
margin)
Policy distortions
1 Distorts the allocation of resources across heterogenous production
units (Static)
Early research on misallocation takes the productivity distribution as
given; Restuccia and Rogerson (2008)
2 Distorts firm-level productivity decisions (Dynamic)
Distortions effectively lower the return to investment in productivity
Nasir Hossein Dad (2023 North American Productivity Conference) Financial Frictions, Policy Distortions and Productivity Investments March 25th, 2023 3 / 33
..

..

..
..
..
..What I do...
1 Empirical: Cross-country evidence highlights importance of equity
markets for TFP , R&D and firm size
2 Theory: Model of optimal productivity investment with equity
frictions and idiosyncratic distortions
3 Quantification: Embed in Hopenhayn (1992) and compare
steady-state equilibria with varying levels of distortions and financial
frictions
4 Investigate the impact of financial frictions, misallocation and their
interaction on aggregate outcomes
Nasir Hossein Dad (2023 North American Productivity Conference) Financial Frictions, Policy Distortions and Productivity Investments March 25th, 2023 4 / 33
..
..
..
..
..
..
..
..
..
..
..
..
..
..
..
..
..
..
..
..What I find...
Economies with higher levels of financial development exhibit higher
aggregate productivity , invest more in productivity and have large
firms
Financial frictions can solely lower aggregate productivity by 22% ,
reduce investments in productivity by 30% and decrease average firm
size by 60%
Financial frictions and misallocation can jointly account for up to
50% of aggregate productivity losses
Dynamics effects of misallocation are important and effects are larger
when equity constraints are tighter
Nasir Hossein Dad (2023 North American Productivity Conference) Financial Frictions, Policy Distortions and Productivity Investments March 25th, 2023 5 / 33

..Related Literature
Financial Frictions and Aggregate Productivity:
Buera et al (2011), Midrigan and Xu (2014), Moll (2014)
(Mis)allocation, Policy Distortions and Aggregate Productivity:
Restuccia and Rogerson (2008), Hsieh and Klenow (2009), Bento and
Restuccia (2017), Restuccia and Rogerson (2017), Da Rocha et al
(2021)
Equity Frictions and Aggregate Productivity
Whited and Zhao (2021), Bento et al (2021), Peters (2021)

..Competitive Equilibrium
Definition
A SSCE is defined as prices w,rlump-sum taxes T, aggregate distribution
of firms Θ( z, τ), value functions; W(z, τ),π(z, τ), policy functions for
firms n(z, τ),Φ( z, τ),z/z0, mass of entry M such that:
(1) Households optimize
(2) Given prices, the value functions solve the firm’s problems and the
policy functions are optimal
(3) Firms optimally choose their productivity growth z/z0
(4) Free entry condition is satisfied implying W(z0, τ i) = 0
(5) Labor market clears: L=R
z,τn(z, τ)dΘ( z, τ)
(6) Budget Balance: T=R
z,ττf(z,n)dΘ( z, τ)
(7)Θ( z, τ)is an invariant distribution

..Calibration Strategy
Approach: Calibrate parameters and distributions such that the stationary
equilibrium is representative of the United States
External Calibration: Assign standard parameters values and estimates
from the literature
Matching Distributions: Match productivity distributions to
empirical counterparts in the data using Business Dynamic Statistics
(BDS)
Internal Calibration: Jointly choose key parameters so that the model
matches facts on productivity growth and equity ratios

..Quantitative Analysis
Analyze the impact of financial frictions and policy distortions and their
interaction on aggregate outcomes
Experiment 1 : Impact of Financial Frictions
Experiment 2 : Non-Systematic Distortions
Experiment 3 : Systematic Distortions
1 Decompose the losses from misallocation into static and dynamic
components
2 Partial re-calibration to Mexico, interaction between financial frictions
and misallocation

..Conclusion
Economies with better equity markets tend to be more productive,
invest more in productivity and have larger firms on average
Develop a framework to rationalize the facts and quantify the impacts
of financial frictions and misallocation
Financial frictions and misallocation can account for up to 50% of
losses in aggregate productivity
Dynamic effects of misallocation is quantitatively important and
increasing in the lvel of equity frictions
More work is needed in identifying and quantifying specific policies
and institutions that generate and have implications beyond
misallocation
